p:
Strain interactions are characterised by three parameters: co-transmission rate ( β d), coefficient of infectivity enhancement within concurrent infection ( ϕ) and cross-immunity during sequential infection ( ψ). It is worth mentioning that because the infectivity enhancement ϕ only directly benefits the transmission of single strains the relative prevalence of concurrent infection ( I
ij ) is mainly determined by β d rather than ϕ as illustrated in Table 2 of [ 16]. Therefore the low number of reported concurrent infections (e.g., [ 32, 60]) should not simply be regarded as a fact for rejecting the infectivity enhancement of single strains which we assumed in this study.
